channel.title: 1. Foundations on The AI Engineer's Handbook
channel.description: Recent content in 1. Foundations on The AI Engineer's Handbook

item.title: Python Essentials
item.description: Python for AI/ML engineers. Virtual environments (venv, conda), pip & dependency management, key libraries (NumPy, Pandas), type hints, async basics, Jupyter notebooks.

item.title: Git & Version Control
item.description: Commits, branches, merges, pull requests. .gitignore for Python/ML projects. Branching strategies (feature branches, trunk-based). Reviewing diffs, rolling back changes. Why AI shouldn’t auto-commit.

item.title: Environment & Secrets
item.description: .env files for configuration. .env.example with placeholders. Never hardcode API keys or secrets. Never share secrets in prompts. Local vs production parity. Secret managers (GCP Secret Manager, AWS Secrets Manager).

item.title: Docker & Containers
item.description: Containerization for reproducible ML environments. Dockerfiles, images, containers. docker-compose for multi-service setups. GPU support with NVIDIA Docker. Container registries. Why containers matter for ML deployment.

item.title: SQL & Databases
item.description: Relational databases (Postgres, MySQL). SQL fundamentals: SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, JOINs. Indexing and query optimization. BigQuery for analytics at scale. Database connections in Python.

item.title: APIs & HTTP
item.description: HTTP fundamentals: verbs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), status codes, headers. REST API design. Building APIs with FastAPI. Authentication (API keys, OAuth, JWT). Rate limiting. OpenAPI/Swagger documentation.

item.title: Data Formats
item.description: JSON for APIs and config. YAML for configuration files. CSV for tabular data. Parquet for efficient ML data storage. Serialization/deserialization in Python. Protocol Buffers for gRPC.

item.title: Data Structures & Complexity
item.description:
Data Structures: Arrays and lists (contiguous memory, O(1) access). Hash tables (key-value mapping, O(1) lookup). Trees (hierarchical data, traversal). Graphs (nodes and edges, adjacency representations).

Complexity Analysis: Big-O notation. Time complexity: O(1), O(log n), O(n), O(nÂ²). Space complexity. Why complexity matters for ML inference at scale. Choosing the right structure for AI/ML pipelines.

item.title: System Design Basics
item.description: Scaling: vertical vs horizontal. Caching strategies: write-through, write-back, LRU eviction. Message queues: producers, consumers, async processing. Load balancing. Stateless vs stateful services. Designing for ML inference workloads.
